did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: This collection contains historic photographs of East Lyme, Connecticut dating from the late 1800s to mid 1900s. Local schools, businesses, events, people, and areas of town are among the subjects documented.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: East Lyme, Connecticut was incorporated as a town in 1839, formed from parts of Lyme and Waterford. It includes two villages, Flanders in the northern part of town and Niantic along the coast.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Photographs in this collection document local schools, churches, businesses, organizations, events, people, and areas of town. Sites documented include the Thomas Lee House, Morton House Hotel, Niantic East Lyme Train Station, Niantic River Bridge, Saunders Point, Pine Grove, Crescent Beach, and Golden Spur. Modes of transportation are documented as well as ice storms and the 1938 Hurricane.
Contained in eleven boxes, the photos date primarily from the late 19th century through the mid 20th century.
